text:
Scott,

There is no need for apologizing. It was not that important and actually I wrote the XMLSocketHubReceiver to connect my LOG4RPG to Chainsaw to ease my life.

Honestly I obviously never tested the XMLSocketHubReceiver with a Java client, because I had to write a XMLSocketAppender to do that now. All I did so far was to connect Chainsaw with my RPG applications running on an IBM i5 (= AS/400).

If you like, I can send two Eclipse projects to you to test the receiver. The first project configures and starts Chainsaw, so you do not really need it. The second project is the XMLSocketHubReceiver along with the brand new XMLSocketAppender (just a clone of the SocketAppender) and a test driver. The test driver is pretty simple. It configures a XMLSocketAppender and sends 60 log events to Chainsaw.

Both projects are around 5MB.

Thomas.

text:
Feel free to download the Eclipse projects from my tools40.de web page:

http://www.tools400.de/Downloads/XMLSocketHubReceiver_v1.0.0.zip

If you want to test it, then you first need to start Chainsaw and then TestXMLSocketHubReceiver. Use 'config_XMLSocketHubReceiver.xml' to configure Chainsaw for the XMLSocketHubReceiver.
